result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan W Schaaf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Psychiatric/psychological evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with SK, EW & BB.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Continue compliance with sex offender registration.  Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

referral to bail monitoring/$1500 cash bond w/ BMP, if defn fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant will be issued.

Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom;Atty VanRybroek argument for bail modification; ADA Barnett objects to motion for bail modification; Ct questions counsel; counsel responds; Ct ruled denying motion for bail modification; Atty VanRybroek requests amending cash bail w/BMP; ADA Barnett responds; Ct ruled, amending cash bail w/BMP; Ct adjourned.

AMENDED CASH BOND - REFERRAL TO BMP
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,500. per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his release from jail.
- If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Skyler K. or Breanna B. or Ellis Williams.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
